result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Bernard White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing on 04/29/2014 is corrected as follows:
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
No nonpayment penalty/civil judgment language ordered/on record.  Done per Court record.
NO JOC printed yet.

Pursuant to negotiations, counts 2 & 3 are dismissed, but read in.  Use of a dangerous weapon modifier is dismissed from Count 1.

As to Counts 1 & 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Gregory H.

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 3 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 86 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.

As to Count 4:
Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 3 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.


Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victims unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 

Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.

Jury trial on 05/05/14 at 08:30 is vacated.

Defendant Jerome Bernard White in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Jerome Bernard White in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
COUNT 4 added: Substantial Battery, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(2), 968.075(1)(a) a Class I felony.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Jerome Bernard White not in court, in custody.  Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Parties are still in negotiations and would like a new date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defense motion to modify the bail is heard and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jerome Bernard White in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Defendant Jerome Bernard White in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Br. 4 for Br. 40.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to Count #1 and maintains the not guilty pleas on counts #2 and #3.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of paper discovery and cd's from the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-5-2014 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 5-5-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Roseanne F or Gregory H

Defendant Jerome Bernard White in court with attorney Gregory Renden.  Defendant Jerome Bernard White in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Preliminary Hearing to be heard by Judge Flanagan for Judge Dallet.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
